definitions: To invent a story or excuse, often to deceive.
To reconcile after an argument or disagreement.
To compensate for something lost, missed, or damaged.
examples: He had to make it up on the spot.
They decided to make it up after their fight.
I'll make it up to you for missing your birthday.
Women make up the majority of the workforce.
pastTenses: made it up, made it up
